hardState.name: Aurora Berg
hardState.description: A towering, many-tiered iceberg whose shelves host rival super-penguin colonies.

hardState.name: Aurora Stack
hardState.description: A vertical colony carved into the sunlit face of Aurora Berg, known for orderly terraces and bright trade banners.

hardState.name: Nightfall Shelf
hardState.description: A shadowed ledge on the far side of Aurora Berg, lit by bioluminescent ice glyphs and whispered deals.

hardState.name: Krill Shoals
hardState.description: Dense drifting clouds of krill that pass regularly beneath Aurora Stack, the lifeblood of its fisheries.

hardState.name: The Glow-Fissure
hardState.description: A deep crack in the ice under Nightfall Shelf that pulses with otherworldly light and warps the currents.

hardState.name: Windward Ridge
hardState.description: A knife-edge crest of ice where the high winds carve strange patterns and carry news between colonies.

hardState.name: The Icebound Exchange
hardState.description: A merchant guild that monopolizes trade through Aurora Stack, issuing carved-ice credit chits and regulating fish prices.

hardState.name: The Midnight Claws
hardState.description: A clandestine syndicate ruling Nightfall Shelf from the shadows, smuggling forbidden tech and siphoning magic from the Glow-Fissure.

hardState.name: High-Beak Auditor Selka
hardState.description: The meticulous mayor of Aurora Stack, famed for balancing ledgers as easily as she balances on sheer ice walls.

hardState.name: Tide-Splitter Rukan
hardState.description: A daring super-penguin hero of Aurora Stack, whose experimental fishing gun techniques doubled the colonyâ€™s catch.

hardState.name: Shadow-Broker Nyla
hardState.description: The unofficial mayor of Nightfall Shelf, a veiled negotiator who settles disputes before anyone admits they exist.

hardState.name: Fissure-Walker Draen
hardState.description: A reckless hero of Nightfall Shelf who walks the very lip of the Glow-Fissure to draw power from its light.

hardState.name: Fissure-Drawn Runes
hardState.description: A school of ice-magic where glowing sigils are etched with claws chilled in the light of the Glow-Fissure.

hardState.name: Harmonic Harpoon Arrays
hardState.description: Advanced fishing guns that fire sonic-locked harpoons, letting penguins reel in entire shoals with minimal effort.

hardState.name: Floe-Keeper Mist
hardState.description: Offspring of High-Beak Auditor Selka, raised among Aurora Stack's orderly terraces where trade banners catch the sunlight. Known for meticulous record-keeping of ice coin schedules and krill net allocations. Carries the practical wisdom of commerce and tradition, though whispers suggest fascination with the bioluminescent mysteries of Nightfall Shelf.

Captain Tidehunter mysteriously vanishes near Nightfall Shelf. 1 individuals begin a desperate search. Most social relationships with Captain Tidehunter fade as they disappear into mystery. Only structural ties and search efforts remain.

The Starfall Collapse: Aurora Stack's expedition to Starfall Reach discovers a cache of pre-penguin artifacts within a destabilizing Glow-Fissure, but the site collapses before full retrieval. Stack claims the artifacts belong to Aurora colony by right of discovery, while Nightfall Shelfâ€”backed by The Icebound Exchangeâ€”asserts that Fissure rights are communal under Frost Guard doctrine. Simultaneously, krill populations mysteriously vanish from traditional Aurora fishing territories, forcing Aurora to encroach on Nightfall waters. The Icebound Exchange exploits the crisis by hoarding melting ice coins and demanding exorbitant prices for emergency supplies. When Aurora's desperate expedition team fails to return from a secondary Starfall attempt, cultural blame fractures the fragile trade agreement. Resource scarcity and artifact control collide as both colonies mobilize armed contingents, shattering the Great Thaw's cooperative period and igniting competing claims that splinter into factional warfare.

loreRecords.text: Floe-Keeper Mist: Offspring of High-Beak Auditor Selka, raised among Aurora Stack's orderly terraces where trade banners catch the sunlight. Known for meticulous record-keeping of ice coin schedules and krill net allocations. Carries the practical wisdom of commerce and tradition, though whispers suggest fascination with the bioluminescent mysteries of Nightfall Shelf.

Draen's reckless fissure-walking destabilized a section of Nightfall Shelf, causing tremors that damaged Midnight Claws supply caches. Glintbeak publicly blamed Draen for endangering colony resources, while Draen accused the Radicals of hoarding knowledge about the fissure's true nature instead of sharing it with Frost Guard researchers. | Stakes: Draen's obsession with fissure power threatens cross-colony stability; Glintbeak's radical faction sees Draen as a symbol of the old guard's recklessness. If Draen's methods prove catastrophic, it could justify the Radicals' push to restrict fissure access entirelyâ€”or worse, weaponize it. | Perception: Nightfall Shelf views Draen as a hero pushing boundaries; The Midnight Claws Radicals paint him as a danger to both colonies. Frost Guard remains officially neutral but quietly concerned. Deep Singers, if aware, see both as missing the fissure's deeper significance.

The Starfall Collapse: Aurora Stack's expedition to Starfall Reach discovers a cache of pre-penguin artifacts within a destabilizing Glow-Fissure, but the site collapses before full retrieval. Stack claims the artifacts belong to Aurora colony by right of discovery, while Nightfall Shelfâ€”backed by The Icebound Exchangeâ€”asserts that Fissure rights are communal under Frost Guard doctrine. Simultaneously, krill populations mysteriously vanish from traditional Aurora fishing territories, forcing Aurora to encroach on Nightfall waters. The Icebound Exchange exploits the crisis by hoarding melting ice coins and demanding exorbitant prices for emergency supplies. When Aurora's desperate expedition team fails to return from a secondary Starfall attempt, cultural blame fractures the fragile trade agreement. Resource scarcity and artifact control collide as both colonies mobilize armed contingents, shattering the Great Thaw's cooperative period and igniting competing claims that splinter into factional warfare.
